title: MarryWithBTC
author: MarryWithBTC
created_time: March 14, 2025, 04:35:47 PMLast edit: March 14, 2025, 05:07:43 PM by MarryWithBTC
content: There was a time when we all pray for Bitcoin to be accepted, to stop being attack by governments, and to reach new heights. Back then, we wanted:1. Government to stop fighting Bitcoin: Today we have Bitcoin presidents (Bukele and Trump) 2. Bitcoin to be legalized: Today bitcoin is a legal tender in El Salvador.3. Bitcoin to be recognize by institutions: Today, we have Bitcoin ETF and even USA is keeping Bitcoin reserve.4. Bitcoin to reach new all time high → Now, Bitcoin have pass $100,000.Everything we wished for is happening, yet many people still find reason to complain. Some say, “Bitcoin is too expensive now” or “Institutions are ruining it”. But was mass adoption not always the goal?Are we just naturally never satisfied, or is there something else?

comments.author: NAZAR2242
comments.body: The bottom line is that people wanted bitcoin to become a convenient, decentralized and promising tool, and it seemed to happen. But they're still unhappy.  There are several obvious reasons for this.Yes, bitcoin has become popular, but it has not solved all the problems. For example, it is still volatile, and transaction fees are sometimes high.Decentralization and security are good, but they make bitcoin slow and not as convenient for everyday payments as we would like.Also, many people wanted to get rich on bitcoin at the time, but not everyone succeeded. Someone bought at the peak of the price and is not complaining about losses.As for regulation, the authorities of many countries have not yet decided how to treat cryptocurrencies, which creates uncertainty and fear.Well, in general, people will always find something to complain about, especially if their expectations were too high.

comments.body: Quote from: MarryWithBTC on March 14, 2025, 04:35:47 PMThere was a time when we all pray for Bitcoin to be accepted, to stop being attack by governments, and to reach new heights. Back then, we wanted:1. Government to stop fighting Bitcoin: Today we have Bitcoin presidents (Bukele and Trump) 2. Bitcoin to be legalized: Today bitcoin is a legal tender in El Salvador.3. Bitcoin to be recognize by institutions: Today, we have Bitcoin ETF and even USA is keeping Bitcoin reserve.4. Bitcoin to reach new all time high → Now, Bitcoin have pass $100,000.Everything we wished for is happening, yet many people still find reason to complain. Some say, “Bitcoin is too expensive now” or “Institutions are ruining it”. But was mass adoption not always the goal?Are we just naturally never satisfied, or is there something else? There was a time when we wanted Bitcoin to be widespread and globally accepted but massive problems started with massive adoption, mining became a commercial business and it significantly affected Bitcoin's decentralization. If years ago everyone could mine Bitcoin with their computer or GPU from home, now that's impossible, even if you own ASICs, you need to have access to very cheap or free electricity. Also, with time, Bitcoin became more controlled and kyc free world disappeared. Also, as Bitcoin became famous, lots of companies and people started manipulating Bitcoin's price. For example, Elon Musk manipulated the price in 2020-2021, then the SEC manipulated it a few months ago, there are also some other examples. Increased adoption and increased popularity are good but it comes with the cost and the cost is heavy.
